intro: Anacampseros millieri, commonly known as the Milliery stonecress, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, white or yellow flowers bloom in clusters, adding a delicate touch to its rugged appearance. Anacampseros millieri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and resilience.
